text: @jlangdale And why hold back emails with a smoking gun?

column4: why would ones yet to be released?

text: @jlangdale Of course there's contact b/w political dir of a news agency & DNC. How do you think journalists get info? It's called reporting.
@jlangdale But let's be straight. This is something you think
column4: not something you know.

text: @jlangdale So you've seen them?
@jlangdale So you know for a fact these emails exist?
@jlangdale ... We're not allowed to slander someone in public just because a hypothetical conspiracy is more interesting than the facts.
@jlangdale This is the difference between journalists and internet trolls...
@jlangdale so you're speculating that hypothetical emails exist to prove a connection b/w Todd & DNC that the leaked ones don't show?
@jlangdale more emails? Which ones are you referring to?
@jlangdale Should he have just ignored DWS's email? Legit asking. I'm trying to understand what you would have done in his place.
@jlangdale I just fail to see what about the outcome - DNC not getting what it wanted - suggests Todd was a DNC lackey.
@jlangdale So DWS sends Todd an email about how she perceives an MSNBC anchor talks about her and it's Todd's fault she sent it?
@SMasters0417 Conclusion: DNC info is valuable for public discourse
column4: but source's motive is potentially problematic.

column4: that raises ethical questions

text: @SMasters0417 But as a journalist
column4: you must consider the motive of the source giving you info.

text: @SMasters0417 I think we agree DNC did something foolish and untoward. I'm not arguing against disclosing the emails.

column4: I'm confused
